title: A Complete Guide to North Node in Aquarius

steps.title: Your life’s focus is to think of other’s needs as well as your known.
steps.content: Your life’s focus is to think of other’s needs as well as your known. In astrology, your north node revolves around the lessons you’re aiming to learn in this lifetime. When your north node falls in Aquarius, your main priority in life is to find a balance between what you need and what others need—and, in turn, learn how to walk a mile in someone else’s shoes. [2] X Research source In astrology, “nodes” aren’t actually planets or asteroids; rather, they represent physical points on your birth chart (specifically, how the Earth, Moon, and Sun align with one another). [3] X Research source North and south nodes always fall on opposite points of your birth chart, and are represented by opposing signs and houses. [4] X Research source Not totally sure what your north node is? Use this online calculator to find out—you’ll need to know your birth time and birthplace. Did You Know? Taylor Swift, Brie Larsen, Liam Neeson, Daniel Radcliffe, and Pierce Brosnan are all Aquarius north nodes. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Many Aquarius north nodes are fairly young.
steps.content: Many Aquarius north nodes are fairly young. North nodes actually cycle backward in the night sky—so, Pisces north node follows Aries north node, which follows Taurus north node, and so on. Aquarius north node cycles directly after Pisces north node, with the most recent cycles occurring between May 23, 1989, and November 18, 1990, as well as December 19, 2007, to August 21, 2009. You’re also an Aquarius north node if your birthday falls between the following date ranges: [6] X Research source March 29, 1952, and October 9, 1953 November 3, 1970, and April 27, 1972

steps.title: Your south node falls in Leo.
steps.content: Your south node falls in Leo. In astrology, your south node represents both the strengths and weaknesses you carry with you from the past (like a past life). [7] X Research source With Leo as your south node, you were probably no stranger to the spotlight and had no trouble commanding attention. In the present, though, your south node placement serves as an important lesson to be mindful of how you treat others and carry yourself around other people. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Compassionate
steps.content: Compassionate You care a lot about the world around you, and you’re doing everything you can to make it a better and fairer place for everyone. This compassion can come in all shapes and sizes—you might be pursuing an environmental science degree with a focus on renewable energy, or you might take time out of your day to sign online petitions and advocate on social media. No matter what, there’s always some cause out there that you’re ready and raring to stand up for. [9] X Research source Tip: Write down a list of the issues that are nearest and dearest to your heart. Are you really passionate about LGBTQ+ equality, or do feel a calling to help end human trafficking? Narrowing down the issues you care about can help you put your compassion into action .

steps.title: Charismatic
steps.content: Charismatic Thanks to your south node Leo, you have no problem connecting with the people around you and getting attention without much effort. You’re great at communicating your thoughts when it comes to new ideas—and, most importantly, you’re great at captivating people with whatever you share. [10] X Research source Tip: Look for healthy opportunities to put yourself in the center of the action, like taking on a leadership role in your volunteer work.

steps.title: Unique
steps.content: Unique You pride yourself on your individuality, and you can’t think of anything worse than being “just like everyone else.” [11] X Research source Above all, you want people to see you for you , rather than seeing you as a nameless face in a large crowd. Tip: Talk to a trusted friend or loved one if you're feeling a bit insecure about your sense of self. Ask them to share what they think some of your most unique traits are—after all, it can be really validating to learn how other people see you!

steps.title: Open-minded
steps.content: Open-minded You aren’t one to stick to tradition. In fact, you’re more than happy to question how and why the world works the way that it does, even if such a thought process goes against your current way of thinking. [12] X Research source Tip: Try playing devil’s advocate in a variety of scenarios, from deep chats with your friends to a dinner table conversation with your family. Giving yourself the freedom to question different types of beliefs and principles may help you view the world with a more open mind .

steps.title: Focus on what you want in the long term rather than in the short term.
steps.content: Focus on what you want in the long term rather than in the short term. It can be super easy to get caught up in what you want right now , like a brand-new laptop or a cool bike. Instead, think about what’s important in the grand scheme of things, like developing financial stability for yourself or applying for your dream job. You’ll feel a lot happier and more content in the long run when you focus on what you need in the long term. [13] X Research source Tip: Make a wishlist of the items you want rather than buying them right away. Then, take a look at the list again a few months later to see if you still really would like some of the items.

steps.title: Get in the habit of letting things go.
steps.content: Get in the habit of letting things go. It can be easy for you to take things pretty personally, even in light-hearted situations. As tricky as it may be at first, practice recognizing what is and isn’t within your control, and making conscious efforts to let go of things that would otherwise bother you. You’ll be a lot happier in the long run! [14] X Research source Tip: Journaling can be an effective way of getting your feelings out and letting them go! If something really gets under your skin, take some time to write about it. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Take advantage of your innate leadership skills.
steps.content: Take advantage of your innate leadership skills. There’s no doubt that you’re an effective leader when you’re put at the helm of a project—so why not embrace that skillset? Whether you’re at work or at school, be on the lookout for opportunities to take the lead in a group activity. [16] X Research source Tip: If you’re given a group assignment at school or work, try taking charge and helping get things organized.

steps.title: Advocate for issues that are important to you.
steps.content: Advocate for issues that are important to you. Do you have a strong stance on a major political or social issue? Look for ways to put yourself out there and advocate for a cause that’s near and dear to your heart, whether that’s attending protests, signing petitions, or calling government officials. [17] X Research source Tip: Look for trustworthy non-profits that advocate for causes that are important to you—they’ll likely have resources and opportunities to help out/volunteer. If you can’t dedicate your physical time to the cause, you can always make a donation!

steps.title: Pursue relationships with people who are your intellectual equals.
steps.content: Pursue relationships with people who are your intellectual equals. Your mind is always on the move, whether philosophizing about the meaning of life or complaining about the injustices of modern society. At the end of the day, you’re looking for someone who can keep up with your trains of thought and actively participate in these types of conversations with you. [18] X Research source Tip: When you first go on a date, test the waters with a philosophical question, like “Do you ever wonder why we’re here?” Then, see how your date responds.

steps.title: Date people who can respect your need for independence and honesty.
steps.content: Date people who can respect your need for independence and honesty. A true Aquarius to your core, you’re on a constant quest for truth and freedom. A long-term relationship might not be in the cards if your significant other can’t understand or respect this need for independence and transparency. [19] X Research source Tip: Set clear boundaries with your partner from the very beginning, letting them know that you value time to yourself as well as clear and honest communication. If they have trouble respecting these guidelines, you might be better off ending things.

steps.title: Take part in a career where you can make a difference.
steps.content: Take part in a career where you can make a difference. For north nodes in Aquarius, advocacy is the name of the game—and what better way is there to do that than by finding a career that puts you in the middle of the action? Look for a job that fits your skillset and educational background, like: [20] X Research source A scientist researching ways to protect endangered species A professor teaching about topics related to social justice A lawyer or other legal professional advocating for underrepresented communities

steps.title: You are creative and skilled when it comes to saving and investing money.
steps.content: You are creative and skilled when it comes to saving and investing money. As a north node in Aquarius, you’re perfectly comfortable stashing your money in a bank account for a rainy day or performing meaningful investments that help diversify your financial portfolio . Trust your instincts when it comes to finances, even if your ideas and processes aren’t always conventional. Chances are, you’ll land on your feet (and be all the richer for it). [21] X Research source Tip: If you’re new to investing, check out free resources like Nerd Wallet , the SEC site , and Investopedia . These sites can all help you learn the ropes of investing and feel a little more confident in your investment plans. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Your house placements help you know what to focus on.
steps.content: Your house placements help you know what to focus on. Your astrological birth chart is split into 12 even segments that are known as “houses,” with each house ruling over specific elements and factors of your life. Knowing which House your north node Aquarius falls under can help provide you with special insights and tips for living your best life. Not sure which House your north node falls under? Take a look at your birth chart for extra guidance.

steps.title: 1st House
steps.content: 1st House If your north node falls in the 1st House , it’s time to embrace who you are and find ways to express yourself authentically. You don’t need to wait for other people to gather around you in order to live your best life—you’re more than capable of doing that on your own! [23] X Research source Tip: Take some time to explore new hobbies and interests , whether that’s starting a book club or giving rock climbing a try . Which activities resonate with you the most? Which ones don’t?

steps.title: 2nd House
steps.content: 2nd House If your north node falls in the 2nd House , it’s time to get a little more imaginative and creative with the way you make a living. Besides your daytime job, are there other side hustles you could be considering? Tip: A side hustle is anything that can net you a little extra cash, whether that’s selling your unwanted items on Facebook Marketplace or walking the dogs around your neighborhood. Take stock of what’s going on in your community and see where your talents and services could be the most useful! [24] X Research source

steps.title: 3rd House
steps.content: 3rd House If your north node sits in the 3rd House, it might be time to approach your general communication style from a new perspective. Make intentional efforts to take a step back when you enter a conversation, giving other people a chance to share their thoughts and ideas. Tip: Try to get in the habit of letting other people talk before you do. If you’re discussing a topic with some friends, pose the question “What are your thoughts on this?” before jumping in and sharing your own.

steps.title: 4th House
steps.content: 4th House If your north node is in the 4th House , take some time to think about how your personal identity lines up with that of your family members. While there’s nothing wrong with wanting to be your own unique person, it can be valuable to find things in common with the people in your life. Tip: Jot down a list of the traits and qualities you have in common with some of your immediate family members—there might be more than you think! Maybe you and your dad are both adrenaline junkies or you and your sibling both love spending time out in nature.

steps.title: 5th House
steps.content: 5th House If your north node falls in the 5th House , it’s time to give yourself permission to approve of your own thoughts and ideas. You don’t need other people’s validation and admiration to move forward (even if it is appreciated)—instead, spend time around people who challenge you rather than unconditionally say “yes” to all of your ideas. Tip: The next time you have a big idea or brainstorm, try posting it in an online community or forum to get an objective sense of how others feel about it.

steps.title: 6th House
steps.content: 6th House If your north node rests in the 6th House , it’s time to take a new look at the way you approach your daily schedule. How can you change things up and break away from the monotony of a daily routine while still accomplishing what you need to get done? Tip: Try making a random or sudden change in your routine at the last moment, like going for a walk before dinner. Making adjustments like this can help boost your brain’s neuroplasticity. [25] X Research source

steps.title: 7th House
steps.content: 7th House If your north node falls in the 7th House , it’s time to accept others—and yourself—exactly as they are. Don’t feel like you need to crack extra jokes or go the extra mile just to get attention; instead, focus on blending in with the energy of the group. Tip: Make an active effort to solicit other people’s thoughts and opinions during a conversation rather than making a silly comment joke. Asking follow-up questions can be a great way to practice active listening and be an active member of a conversation!

steps.title: 8th House
steps.content: 8th House Take some time to understand what makes you tick if your north node falls in the 8th House . What unique traits or habits do you bring to the table? What are some unique traits or idiosyncrasies that you notice in others? Tip: In your free time, take a moment to sit somewhere in public (like on a public bench) and observe the people around you . What do you notice some of these people doing? What are they talking about?

steps.title: 9th House
steps.content: 9th House If your north node sits in the 9th House , it’s time to open up your mind to the universe and all of its possibilities—even the unlikely ones. Take a closer look into a religion or spiritual belief you’ve never explored before, or dive into some of the zaniest alien abduction stories that the internet has to offer. Tip: Do you have a friend or loved one who practices a specific religion or set of spiritual beliefs? Ask them to share a little bit of their faith with you, so you can understand why they believe what they believe.

steps.title: 10th House
steps.content: 10th House If your north node rests in the 10th House , it might be time to embrace relationships and connections outside of your immediate household/family. It’s okay (and important) to spend time with different people! Tip: Take an inventory of how much time you spend at home versus how much time you spend out with friends/acquaintances. While there’s nothing wrong with hanging out at home, it never hurts to step out of your comfort zone and spend a little more time with different people.

steps.title: 11th House
steps.content: 11th House If your north node is in the 11th House, it could be time to fall out of love with the idea of love. Instead of automatically putting every romance and love story out there on a pedestal, try to view these relationships from a more realistic angle. [26] X Research source Tip: It’s true that no relationship out there is perfect—but that’s okay! It’s important to remember that real love revolves around healthy communication and honesty, rather than the idealized scenes from the movies.

steps.title: 12th House
steps.content: 12th House Take a closer look at your attitude toward work if your north node sits in the 12th House . There’s nothing wrong with stepping up and being a leader, but it isn’t ideal to step into the role of “leader” when one isn’t needed. Instead, look for opportunities to be a team player . Tip: Be on the lookout for chances to really work as a collective unit with your co-workers. This could involve joining your work’s softball league or starting up a recycling initiative with some other team members.
